item.title: Russian Hackers Exploited 7-Zip Zero-Day Against Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Russian threat groups have been observed exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in 7-Zip against Ukrainian entities.

The post Russian Hackers Exploited 7-Zip Zero-Day Against Ukraine appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of February 3, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of February 3, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Chrome 133, Firefox 135 Patch High-Severity Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Chrome 133 and Firefox 135 were released with patches for multiple high-severity memory safety vulnerabilities.

The post Chrome 133, Firefox 135 Patch High-Severity Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Webinar Today: Defenders on the Frontline – Incident Response and Threat Intel Under the Microscope
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Join this panel of CISOs and threat-intel professionals for a deep-dive on aligning incident response and threat intelligence with broader business objectives.

The post Webinar Today: Defenders on the Frontline – Incident Response and Threat Intel Under the Microscope  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CISA Issues Exploitation Warning for .NET Vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
CISA has added CVE-2024-29059, a flaw affecting Microsoft .NET, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog.

The post CISA Issues Exploitation Warning for .NET Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Zyxel Issues ‘No Patch’ Warning for Exploited Zero-Days
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Multiple Zyxel legacy DSL CPE products are affected by exploited zero-day vulnerabilities that will not be patched.

The post Zyxel Issues ‘No Patch’ Warning for Exploited Zero-Days appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Sophos Completes Acquisition of Secureworks
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Sophos has completed its $859 million all-cash acquisition of SecureWorks.

The post Sophos Completes Acquisition of Secureworks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Exploitation of Over 700 Vulnerabilities Came to Light in 2024
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The number of vulnerabilities first reported as exploited surged last year amid a decrease in zero-day reports.

The post Exploitation of Over 700 Vulnerabilities Came to Light in 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 22 New Mac Malware Families Seen in 2024
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Nearly two dozen new macOS malware families were observed in 2024, including stealers, backdoors, downloaders and ransomware. 

The post 22 New Mac Malware Families Seen in 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: AMD Patches CPU Vulnerability That Could Break Confidential Computing Protections
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
AMD has released patches for a microprocessor vulnerability found by Google that could allow an attacker to load malicious microcode.

The post AMD Patches CPU Vulnerability That Could Break Confidential Computing Protections appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Personal Information Compromised in GrubHub Data Breach
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Food delivery firm GrubHub has disclosed a data breach impacting the personal information of drivers and customers.

The post Personal Information Compromised in GrubHub Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.
